page.title: 19ATTITUDES
page.content: Most village activities are run for or by women.Although some men are prominent on committees,it is women who have most influence on village life.Men traditionally commute to work,do not form the same social relations,pursue more individual hobbies & so can easily feel detached from village life,whereas women are more home & village based with time & energy to spare.From their children'S earliest days mothers continually socialise at toddler group,playgroup,school gates or while taxi-ing them about.Important links are formed here & reinforced at coffee mornings,jumbles,on committees etc. Many significant influential women are not indigenous Dorset people with relatives nearby,perhaps their social network compensates for loss of the extended family.
